entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued December 02 at 7:45PM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LOCALLY DENSE FOG DEVELOPING EAST OF BLUE RIDGE... Locally dense fog is now developing in many areas between the Blue Ridge and the Interstate 95 corridor, as a steady light to moderate rain begins to overspread the area. This is reducing visibility to one mile or less. As the fog expands and thickens tonight, expect Dense Fog Advisories to be issued.

entry.title: Flood Watch issued December 02 at 10:35AM PST by NWS
entry.summary: .An active weather pattern will continue with a series of frontal systems set to move across the Pacific Northwest through the middle of next week. Heavy rain and mountain snow through tonight will transition to primarily rain Sunday into next week as an atmospheric river moves over the Pacific Northwest.
